lines.text: What're we supposed to remember, Nana? How, at one time, were we able to protect those we loved? How, in Africa world, we were kings and queens and built great big cities?

Eli, I'm trying to teach you how to touch your own spirit. I'm fighting for my life, Eli, and I'm fighting for yours. Look in my face! I'm trying to give you something to take north with you, along with all your great big dreams.

I am the first and the last. I am the honored one and the scorned one. I am the whore and the holy one. I am the wife and the virgin. I am the barren one and many are my daughters. I am the silence that you can not understand. I am the utterance of my name.
When I left this island, I was a sinner and I didn't even know it. But I left this island, touched over to the mainland, and fell into the arms of the Lord.
What they got out there, Viola?
Life, child, the beginning of a new life.
Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
If Nana Peazant wants to live and die on this island, then God bless her old soul.
Maybe when we go North, you can take more with you than Eula and your dreams.
I ain't got no more dreams, cousin.
LOOK UP AND REMEMBER IBO LANDING!
They're not supposed to die. It ain't right! There supposed to die and go to heaven! It ain't right.
There must be a connection... We are two people in one body; nanas of the old and the force of the new.
We stay behind on this island growing older, wiser, stronger.
